labels.defineUsers: Define User Privileges Roles and Groups

description.dataplane: Welcome to Hortonworks Data Plane, your one-stop solution to data management. To start, you need to configure the LDAP/Knox properties in Data plane to enable dataplane to use your LDAP as the authentication database. Optionally, you can add Dataplane Administrators. Please proceed by clicking on GET STARTED
description.setupAuth: The first step is to help data plane connect to your LDAP and Knox by providing the LDAP, Knox configurations to Data plane.
description.defineUsers: After connecting Data plane with your LDAP, you can add administrators to Data plane. This step is optional. You can add/modify users to data plane or assign/modify their roles anytime through the User Management Screen.
description.setService: Set up services to enable Dataplane to manage your data

labels.emptySearchResult: There are no clusters that match your search.

description.addCluster: Add your Ambari managed cluster to Dataplane. This enables Dataplane to gather information about the cluster such as the name of the cluster, services running in the cluster etc.
description.datalake: This cluster has been indentified as a Datalake since it has data management services,  {{serviceNames}} running.
description.clusterAddSuccess: Your cluster has been added to dataplane.
description.connectionFailed: Dataplane could not retreive cluster information.

connectionFailureReasons.ambariServerDown: Check if the Ambari server is up and running in the given url
connectionFailureReasons.insufficientAccessRights: Make sure that you have right access rights to the ambari server

labels.creator: Creator
labels.name: Name
labels.emptySearchResult: There are no data sets that match your search.

ds-editor.ds-description: Organize your data-assets including Hive & Hbase tables, HDFS Files into logical groups for subsequent usage.
ds-editor.tagDescription: Add tags to your data-set for context and subsequent lookup
ds-editor.asset-description: Add related data assets into your data-set, by searching across the Data-Lake

asset-search.noSearchMsg: Please search for assets above or use Advanced Search
